javadoc: This class provides a panel that contains a JList component.

methods.javadoc: Constructs a new ListPanel.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new ListPanel.

methods.name: setSelectionMode
methods.comment:
Sets the selection mode for the list.
 See JList for allowed Selection modes

methods.javadoc:
Places a title just above the scrolling list.
@param listTitle the title to use.
methods.name: setListTitle
methods.comment: Places a title just above the scrolling list.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if no list items are selected.
methods.name: isSelectionEmpty
methods.comment: Returns true if no list items are selected.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the first selected value in the list or null if nothing
 is selected.
methods.name: getSelectedValue
methods.comment:
Returns the first selected value in the list or null if nothing
 is selected.

methods.javadoc: Get the index of the selected item in the list.
methods.name: getSelectedIndex
methods.comment: Get the index of the selected item in the list.

methods.javadoc:
Select the item at the given index.
@param i the index at which to get the item.
methods.name: setSelectedIndex
methods.comment: Select the item at the given index.

params.name: i
params.comment: the index at which to get the item.

methods.javadoc:
Selects the item.
@param item the item to select
methods.name: setSelectedValue
methods.comment: Selects the item.

methods.javadoc: Returns an array of all the selected items.
methods.name: getSelectedValues
methods.comment: Returns an array of all the selected items.

methods.javadoc:
replaces the list contents with the new list.
@param dataList the new list for the contents.
methods.name: refreshList
methods.comment: replaces the list contents with the new list.

params.name: dataList
params.comment: the new list for the contents.

methods.javadoc:
Sets a ListModel for the internal Jlist to use.
@param listModel the list model to use.
methods.name: setListModel
methods.comment: Sets a ListModel for the internal Jlist to use.

methods.javadoc: Get the list model for the list.
methods.name: getListModel
methods.comment: Get the list model for the list.

methods.javadoc: Return the JList component.
methods.name: getList
methods.comment: Return the JList component.

methods.javadoc:
Get the cell renderer for the list.
@param r the cell renderer to use.
methods.name: setCellRenderer
methods.comment: Get the cell renderer for the list.

methods.name: setListSelectionListener
methods.comment: Sets the listener to be notified when the selection changes.

params.name: listener
params.comment:
the Listener to be notified.  If listener can be null, which
 means no one is to be notified.

methods.name: setDoubleClickActionListener
methods.comment: Sets the listener to be notified whenever a list item is doubleClicked.

params.name: listener
params.comment:
the Listener to be notified.  If listener can be null, which
 means no one is to be notified.

methods.javadoc:
Set the mouse listener for the list.
@param l the mouse listener to set.
methods.name: setMouseListener
methods.comment: Set the mouse listener for the list.

methods.javadoc:
Displays a standard warning message about no selected objects
 in the list.
methods.name: issueWarning
methods.comment:
Displays a standard warning message about no selected objects
 in the list.

methods.name: issueWarning
methods.comment: Displays any warning message.

params.name: title
params.comment: the title of the dialog to display.

methods.javadoc:
Scroll viewport such that the index is visible.
@param index the index of the item in the list to make visible.
methods.name: ensureIndexIsVisible
methods.comment: Scroll viewport such that the index is visible.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index of the item in the list to make visible.

methods.javadoc:
Simple test for ListPanel class.
@param args test args not used
methods.name: main
methods.comment: Simple test for ListPanel class.

name: ListPanel
comment: This class provides a panel that contains a JList component.

fields.name: DEFAULT_WARNING
fields.constant_value: "You must first select an item from the list."
